Name: Version 1.1.4 is out! Blender 3.4 fixes, Scene selection, Per-Node OptiX

Segments.Text: V1.1.4 adds fixes for Blender 3.4 on Linux, Scene selection, and allows a per node configuration to OptiX. (CUDA + OptiX Engine dropdown is still supported for quick switching)
If you find BlendFarm productive, please consider dropping a donation on Patreon!

Name: Version 1.1.3 is out! HIP, Metal, OneAPI, Reconnection during render

Segments.Text: V1.1.3 adds support for HIP, Metal and OneAPI (although untested as I dont have the hardware ready at the moment, but should work as expected). It also adds some logic that attempts to reconnect on client disconnection during rendering.
If you find BlendFarm productive, please consider dropping a donation on Patreon!

Name: Version 1.1.2 is out! Animation File Formats, OpenSSL3.x Support

Segments.Text: V1.1.2 restructures some code, and now allows animations to be rendered to specific file formats (eg. EXR). Some formats will not have previews in app. Besides file formats it also updates the runtime to .NET6, which now should support OpenSSL3.x which some Linux distros decided on changing to
If you find BlendFarm productive, please consider dropping a donation on Patreon!

Name: Version 1.1.1 is out! Animation performance improvements

Segments.Text: V1.1.1 Improves the speed at which multiple renders of the same file are rendered. Depending on the file this can be speed increase 20% for tasks such as animation.
Next month will likely be a rewrite of some internal systems including more output supports.

Name: Version 1.1.0 is out! OptiX and progress fix

Segments.Text: V1.1.0 Adds support for OPTIX, and now has an 'Engine' dropdown under System. It also fixes progress bar for Blender 3.0
Animation performance update is schedules for somewhere next month!
V1.0.9 brings support for using network shares instead of syncing, as well as limited Eevee support (Requires display due to Blender)
Blender 3.0 changed the Cycles GPU api, v1.0.8.1 fixes GPU rendering for Blender >=3.0
A new version of BlendFarm is available. This version supports Blender 3.0 after API changes. It also adds requested feature of saving render settings.
A new version of BlendFarm is available. This version includes queueing and multi-project tabs. It will now have an announcement system to inform you of new versions. And of course some bug fixes.
If you find any bugs please create an issue in the Github Repository. And if you are enjoying BlendFarm, please consider a donation on Patreon
